alert.note: Alert for Jackson (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 10 at 9:50PM CDT until May 13 at 8:26AM CDT by NWS Houston - Galveston
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Texas... Navidad River at Strane Park affecting Jackson County. For the Navidad River...including Sublime, Speaks, Morales, Strane Park...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM THURSDAY EVENING TO SATURDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Navidad River at Strane Park. * WHEN...From Thursday evening to Saturday morning. * IMPACTS...At 26.0 feet, Moderate lowland flooding begins threatening livestock and property in the river channel. The right approach to the County Road 401 bridge is closed making travel difficult. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:15 PM CDT Wednesday the stage was 18.9 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late tomorrow evening to a crest of 25.2 feet early Friday afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage Friday evening. - Flood stage is 24.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 25.3 feet on 06/12/2004. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (7 pm CDT) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Thu Fri Sat Navidad River Strane Park 24.0 18.9 Wed 9 pm CDT 23.3 24.7 11.1 &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Thursday morning at 945 AM CDT.
